file_content.text: I am Freher Wonn, of the Sons of Palawa. You have won this battle, and I call for parley.
You've brutalized our keepings. Tell us why our wives and children weep, so that this feud may be honorable.
Honor means nothing to me. Only power matters.
"Honorable"? Fool.
One can have honor and power. I've fought enough Sith to see proof.
I thought slaughtering your people would be fun.
It amused me.
You truly are despicable.
There's no room for honor in this job.
I don't have that luxury.
Then you have my pity.
It's nothing personal. I go where the contract takes me.
It's just a job.
I understand. I was once like you.
This wasn't my choice. I wanted to avoid violence.
I'm sorry for all this.
Then you shouldn't have come here at all.
Your battle droids had data I required.
I needed information.
Then you fight for resources. There are worse causes.
We know about the Empire's expedition. Whatever you're after, you won't find it--the desert protects its own.
And though we can't keep you from departing--beware Tatooine, and beware our vengeance. You've made an enemy today.
You won't survive long enough to get revenge.
Time to die.
And your bloodlust will lead to your death!
Vengeance can wait. For now, we can part in peace.
I'll be leaving, then.
Go. We have injured to tend to and graves to dig. We'll meet again soon enough.
